name: Agriculture & Livestock Nutrient Pressure
functionStatement: Nitrogen and phosphorus transformations feed primary production, regulate excess loads, and store or release nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: "Extent of agricultural land use and/or livestock access in the watershed, which can contribute nutrients, bacteria, and sediment. Screening metric used to evaluate Nutrient cycling based on the definition and bin thresholds provided for this metric."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Desktop (land cover/listings) and/or Field screening
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Use land cover/agricultural datasets and imagery to quantify agricultural extent and identify livestock access where specified. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Use available GIS layers/imagery and/or a field screening (as applicable) to quantify or rate the metric according to the provided bin thresholds."

inputs.label: Agriculture & Livestock Nutrient Pressure
inputs.helpMarkdown: "NLCD Land Cover; USDA Cropland Data Layer (CDL) (if used); recent imagery; local agricultural layers. State/agency datasets, GIS/imagery, and field observations (as applicable)."

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: There is little to no agricultural land uses or the livestock or cropland is far enough away from project reach to cause no impact to water quality or biology. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Livestock access to stream and/or intensive cropland upstream of project reach. A sufficient reach of stream is between Ag. land use and project reach. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Livestock access to stream and/or intensive cropland immediately upstream of project reach. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
